title: Research Business Manager
content:
At Aquatic, we are actively recruiting for a Research & Development Business Operations Manager. In this role, you will work directly with our R&D team to push initiatives forward by overseeing a wide variety of projects from conceptual design through implementation. This role works directly with both Research, Technology and Aquatic Leadership and covers the entire scope of the research & development process. 
Role Details

Work cross-functionally to enable Aquatic to scale across research & development capability building and identify, implement process improvements across research & development projects
In each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate and test hypotheses, develop and communicate recommendations to senior leadership in collaboration with research & development colleagues
Build comprehensive project plans that merge R&D requirements with company goals and coordinate various personnel across all project phases, from initial development through implementation

Technical Experience: 

Background in engineering, computer science or related field, or equivalent work experience
Organizational skills that can be applied to overseeing project from inception to completion
Must be able to program in Python

Candidate Qualities: 

3-5 years of experience, ideally in a top-tier technology firm or start-up with a focus on data science / business operations; may also come from management consulting data science backgrounds
Rigorous analytical skills and experience with data analysis and/or light software engineering tasks
Excellent project management skills with a track record of organizing and delivering cross-functional projects with explicit timelines
Strong bias for action
Driven by accountability and internal urgency
Comfortable providing and receiving actionable feedback in a collaborative team setting
Motivated by an ambitious environment and driven colleagues 
Strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to present a polished, professional, and diplomatic image to all stakeholders

Aquatic Capital 
Aquatic is a quantitative trading and investment company recently launched by Jon Graham. Prior to founding Aquatic, Jon was a Partner and Senior Managing Director at Citadel, where he worked for more than 13 years. At Citadel, Jon held numerous senior positions over the years, including head of Statistical Arbitrage and Equity High Frequency, culminating in leading the highly successful Global Quantitative Strategies business.  
Uncluttered by legacy platforms and processes, Aquatic develops systematic investment strategies, enabled by a leading-edge research and development platform. The vision is simple: to build a world class, quantitative trading company with a collaborative team of highly capable researchers and engineers.
This role represents a unique opportunity to join a distinguished and hugely successful quantitative investment manager at the foundational level of building a world class operation from scratch. The firmâ€™s culture will be shaped by collaboration, meritocracy, ambition, and calm determination.

values.label: No. already has permanent work authorization
